incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Uploads, Downloads, public API

incident_updates.body:
_Notice and disclaimer: Box is providing this preliminary information subject to further review and analysis. To the best of our knowledge, this is the current state and we will update as more information is confirmed._

 

Between **January 23rd 11:46am PST** and **January 26th 3:11pm PST**, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, a newly re-deployed load balancer instance had a faulty network connection which caused it to be unreachable from our internal network resulting in timeouts for any traffic that it processed, ultimately resulting in users seeing their uploads or downloads timeout. The issue occurred due to incorrect automated networking setup of the new load balancer instance**.** We were able to resolve the issue by removing the faulty instance from the pool. In addition, we are working on improving our health-checks for newly deployed instances to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

‌

We are conducting a full engineering postmortem and our overview is subject to change with further analysis and findings. We will publish the results as soon as we have concluded our investigation.

 

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved.
Please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com/ if you continue to experience any issues
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We have observed an impact to our Public API, Upload and Download services. We are actively investigating to identify the cause of these issues and will provide further updates as as it becomes available.

incidents.name: [Minor] Issue with Uploads, Downloads, and Public API

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Desktop Applications \(Box Sync, Box Drive\), Box Web Application \(Uploads/Downloads\), and Box Platform / API \(Uploads/Downloads\). We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 3:30pm PDT and 4:17pm PDT on Jan 9th, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working on the Box platform. During this time, users may have experienced slow login times as well as failures when attempting to upload and download files. 

## **Analysis**

The issue occurred as an unexpected result of a resource utilization priority conflict during the deployment process of an internal tool. Specifically, an internal service being deployed to our production environment had a higher resource utilization priority than another critical system process, which subsequently failed when affected nodes’ resources were exhausted. We were able to resolve the issue by reverting the change.

In addition, we are improving our change risk assessment criteria and health alerts for this kind of tool, and working to design a more progressive deployment process for this internal tool to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

## **Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Improving our risk assessment criteria for deploying these types of tools. 

* Extending our capacity guidelines to provide more clarity around system resource consumption and better resource distribution.
* Increasing our alerting to detect early warning signs of systems running at a higher capacity than expected.

 

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved. All services have been restored to full functionality. If you continue to experience any issues, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.
Our team has taken steps to remediate this issue and is seeing improvement for these services. We are continuing to monitor for any additional impact.

Our team is investigating an issue with Uploads, Downloads, the Public API, and Box Web Application. Users may see errors or slowness when attempting to use these services. We will provide additional information as it becomes available.

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Downloads and performance with Box.com

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Box activity, including Box Metadata, file uploads and downloads, Box Notes, and the public API. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

Between 9:44 pm PST on December 4, 2022 and 12:32 am PST on December 5, 2022 and between 4:00 pm PST and 5:53 pm PST on December 5, 2022, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users may have experienced higher than normal latency and/or timeouts when trying to access content in Box via one of our applications or our Public API. The issue occurred due to a sudden surge in traffic to a localized area of our metadata cluster, resulting in increased request queue latencies and degradation of Downloads, Box Notes, Metadata and other related services. The issue was resolved after the traffic to the servers hosting the data was decreased. We have since then made observability improvements to identify similar traffic surges faster and are working on process and tooling improvements to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

‌

**Analysis** 

This issue occurred due to a sudden surge in traffic to a localized area of our metadata cluster. Although Box is designed to be capable of handling short surges in traffic, this issue was caused by a sustained increase in traffic directed to a single server. As a result, requests to this server developed a backlog, which affected latency of Box Metadata generally; this resulted in users experiencing degradation of uploads, downloads, Box Notes, and other related services. The issue was resolved after the traffic to server hosting the data was decreased.  We are working on improvements to how data is sharded and cached and also process and tooling improvements to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

‌

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Added observability improvements to identify similar traffic surges more rapidly
* Added additional caching to proactively limit localized surges in traffic to individual servers
* Added the ability to quickly react and throttle surges in traffic to individual servers
* Improving resilience of Box services to high latencies when accessing data stores to minimize the impact of any similar issues in the future

‌

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved.  Performance with Box.com has been restored to full functionality. If you continue to experience any issues, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.

Our team has taken steps to remediate this issue and Box.com service should be returned to full functionality. We are continuing to monitor for any additional impact and will follow up with additional information. 


If you are experiencing performance issues with Box.com, please submit a support ticket to https://support.box.com and we would be happy to address the issue from there

On 12/5/2022 at 5:53 PM PST/7:53 PM CST we have identified and mitigated the issues affecting performance with Box.com. We are continuing to monitor these services and will provide further updates. 

If users are continuing to experience issues related to slowness with Box.com, please submit a ticket to https://support.box.com for further assistance.

At 7:22 PM CST/ 5:22 PM PST we have determined that our Public API Service is not affected. Users may experience slowness with Box.com. Our team is continuing the investigation to identify the issues being experienced with Box.com and will provide further updates as our investigation continues.

On 12/5/2022 at 6:19 PM CST/4:19 PM PST we have observed an impact to our Public API and Download services. Some users may experience issues with downloads, Public API and performance issues with Box.com. We are actively investigating to identify the cause of these issues and will provide further updates as issues continue.

incidents.name: [Minor] Issues Accessing Box

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting access to Box for some customers. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 2:13 am PST and 2:55 am PST on December 1, 2022, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time. users of some enterprises with Device Trust checks enabled may have experienced intermittent 500 errors when logging in to Box or accessing the All Files page. 

‌

**Analysis** 

The issue occurred as a result of a recent code change related to Box's Device Trust feature. Due to incorrect estimates of user traffic, the authentication flow service would transiently block some users from accessing Box. We were able to revert the problematic code and correct faulty assumptions in the days following the incident.  In addition, our performance testing has been revised and new observability measures have been implemented to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

‌

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Improving Device Trust performance testing process to provide a reasonable safety buffer.
* Improving Device Trust observability to revert faulty changes at the time of deployment.
* Increasing Device Trust hardware resources.

‌

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

From approximately 2:13AM-2:55AM PT, some users may have experienced intermittent 500 errors when logging in to Box or accessing the All Files page. This issue was automatically detected by our internal monitoring and a fix was implemented. If you are still experiencing any issues with these services, please contact Box Support via https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Shield - Admin, Classification, Manual Classification.

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Shield and Classification. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

Between 5:16 PM PDT and 7:40 PM PDT on November 23, 2022, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, it was not possible to access Shield Admin pages, the Shield Admin dashboard and the Classification Label admin pages. Additionally, some users may have experienced issues manually classifying files and folders. The issue occurred as a result of an inadequate capacity configuration that prevented a service from starting gracefully after rebooting. We were able to resolve the issue by increasing the capacity of the affected service. In addition, we are working to extend our capacity guidelines and to improve our alerting capabilities to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

‌

**Analysis** 

The service affected by this incident recently experienced a significant increase in traffic as a result of the release of a new feature. Although the service remained stable after the feature’s release, the temporary degradation of another supporting service resulted in an increased number of retries, which in turn resulted in increased processing activity. As a result of this increased CPU usage, the impacted service eventually rebooted, but was unable to effectively reboot because the memory currently allocated for that service was inadequate during this window of increased processing activity. We were able to resolve the issue by increasing the capacity of the affected service.

‌

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Extending our capacity guidelines to provide more clarity around system restart considerations.
* Increasing our alerting to detect early warning signs of systems running at a higher capacity than expected.
* Improving the documentation of our existing alerts to allow us to respond more quickly to system reboot issues.

‌

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved. Box Shield Service has been restored to full functionality. 

If you continue to experience any issues, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Major] Latency with Some Box Services

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting permissions checks in multiple Box services. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

On November 23rd, 2022 between 10:39 AM and 11:29 AM, some users may have experienced difficulties while accessing content in Box. During this time, permissions checks were not available for certain workflows, which caused multiple services to stop allowing access. The issue occurred due to a non-backward-compatible change that was introduced while adding a feature intended to improve the performance of permissions checks. We were able to resolve the issue by reverting the change. In addition, we are working to improve our testing and monitoring processes to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

‌

**Analysis**

Permissions checks depend on a schema. In order to make checks faster, we are adding support for bulk lookups, a feature that will reduce the number of requests to other internal services and thus improve the response time. Some new fields required for the bulk-lookups feature were added in a way that made the change non-backward-compatible, causing services to fail in production. This failure rendered the permissions system temporarily unable to grant access to certain content in Box.

‌

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Add tests to ensure backwards-compatibility.
* Enhance our code-review checklist to add looking for non-backwards-compatible changes.
* Improve our deployment process to add more training for developers who publish permissions changes.

‌

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

From approximately 10:30AM-11:37AM PT, users may have experienced intermittent issues loading some Box services including the Admin Console, Collections, Annotations, File Request Links, Notification Center, and Relay. This issue was automatically detected by our internal monitoring and a fix was implemented. If you are still experiencing any issues with these services, please contact Box Support via https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with generating Content Preview

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting conversion latencies for Sharepoint or Microsoft Excel files. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between November 15, 2022 at 7:12 am PST and November 16, 2022 at 3:04 am PST, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, customers may have experienced preview conversion latencies for Sharepoint or Microsoft Excel files. The issue occurred as a result of a reduction of available conversion capacity as part of ongoing data center migrations. We were able to resolve the issue by provisioning additional capacity in their place. In addition, operational process and tooling will be implemented to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

‌

**Analysis** 

As part of a data center migration, hosts for the conversion service were removed from production before replacement capacity was brought online, resulting in a 15% loss to conversion capacity. The capacity loss and root cause were identified right away and additional capacity was brought online to compensate. 

‌

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Process updates have been enabled to better facilitate communication between Infrastructure and Capacity teams to minimize the likelihood of similar issues occurring in the future.
* Changes to automation for the validation of capacity requests have been enacted.
* Canary rollout of windows related changes for the conversion service will be enabled. 

‌

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Uploads, Downloads and Box Notes

incident_updates.body:
_We recently addressed issues affecting uploads, downloads and notes. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future._

 

_On October 19, 2022 between 6:34 AM PDT and 9:25 AM PDT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some Box users may have experienced issues with uploads, downloads, notes, and public API. The issue occurred as a result of an IPSec link failure, which resulted in intermittent packet loss and latency._

‌

_Analysis _

‌

_As Box moves to GCP, we are in a transitionary period where we run a subset our services on GCP and on-prem. During a recent event, we had a secure network link failure that caused traffic saturation. During this time, services connecting GCP and our on-prem data center had communication impact, which led to an impact to Box services used by customers._ 

‌

_Corrective Actions_

_The following corrective actions have been completed:_

* _Quickly recovered the failed link to address the underlying issue._
* _Doubled additional capacity to avoid this issue from occurring again in the future._

‌

_We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter._ 

 

_Sincerely,_

_The Box Team_
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

incidents.name: [MAJOR] Issues with API uploads, downloads and previewing Microsoft Office Online

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting uploads, downloads, notes, and public API. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

Between 6:55 pm PDT and 7:07 pm PDT on October 16, 2022, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some Box users may have experienced issues with uploads, downloads, notes and public API. The issue occurred as a result of a latent issue with platform workload initialization controllers failing to detect new workloads. 

‌

**Analysis** 

This issue was the result of a controller component that provides service-to-service authentication failing to detect that new workloads needed to be processed. This controller monitors an internal API for new workloads that match certain criteria indicating that the workloads are initializing and waiting for internal credentials. In this case, the impacted controller failed to detect new workloads waiting in the API results that should have been processed. We were able to resolve the issue by restarting the controllers and the new workloads were processed. In addition, we also added alerts to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. The existing alerting in place was monitoring the controllers for errors, but because the controllers were idle, no alerts were immediately raised. 

‌

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Improve alerting on the workloads if they time out while waiting for the controller to process them.
* Replace the controller with a more robust method of authenticating workloads.

‌

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team
From approx 7:00 PM-8:00 PM PDT, we had observed issues with uploads and downloads for our API service in addition to previewing with Microsoft Office Online. The issue has since been resolved.

incidents.name: [MAJOR] Degradation of Syncing from Web App to Box Drive

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Box Drive, Box Sync, and 3rd party users of User Events API. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between Oct 11, 2022 11:00 AM PDT and Oct 13, 2022 11:30 AM PDT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users may have experienced synchronization issues with the Box Drive file system, Box Sync, and 3rd party users of events API. The issue occurred as a result of a recent code change made as part of our ongoing effort to migrate to GCP. We were able to resolve the issue by reverting the change. In addition, we will add more testing to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

**Analysis** 

This issue occurred after a code change was made as part of our ongoing effort to migrate to GCP. The issue was caused due to a coding bug in the failure handling of certain events which resulted in failed events being dropped instead of retried. This caused Box Drive, Box Sync and user events API users to get out of sync by missing events.

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* The coding bug responsible for the issue has been identified and corrected.
* Improving our testing to minimize the likelihood of similar issues occurring in the future.

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

Box has identified and resolved issues with syncing from the Web Application (Box.com) to Box Drive where new changes made in the Web App are not synced to Box Drive. 

In case users notice any discrepancies with some files/folders not being available on Box Drive, please have users use the Refresh Button as detailed in our Known Product Issues page below: 
https://support.box.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045231753-Known-Product-Issues

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Office Online

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Box’s Office Online integration. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

On Tuesday, September 27th 2022 between 3:00 PM PDT and 5:09 PM PDT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, users experienced degraded performance opening and editing Office files in Box. The issue occurred as a result of a configuration change made as part of our ongoing effort to improve security. We were able to resolve the issue by provisioning more resources to the impacted Box systems. In addition, we are implementing code changes to increase the resiliency of the impacted systems to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

**Analysis** 

The issue occurred as a result of a configuration change intended to improve the security of inter-service communication at Box. This change resulted in an unexpected increase in CPU load on one of our backend services, which prevented it from readily processing Office Online requests. This issue was compounded when impacted requests were re-attempted, which ultimate resulted in performance issues across the Office Online integration. The team provisioned additional resources to the impacted services, which mitigated the increased load and allowed Box’s functionality to return to normal.

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Improving our accounting of the resource impact of similar security changes to ensure our services can handle them.
* Improving the resiliency of the services at issue to minimize the impact of an increase in retried requests to prevent CPU issues from compounding.

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

From approximately 03:00 PM to 05:10 PM US Pacific time, we had an issue impacting Office Online. Our systems automatically detected and corrected the underlying issue. incidents.name: [Critical] Box Logins with SSO and Box Notes

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting  SSO Logins and Box Notes. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

‌

Between between 07:42 AM and 08:47 AM PDT on September 14, 2022 , some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, customers may have experienced issues with SSO Logins and Box Notes. The issue occurred due to a failure in the network connecting one of our points of presence \(POPs\) to Box’s Application Data Center \(ADC\).  We were able to resolve the issue by implementing backbone routing changes to bypass the affected network path**.** In addition, we are working towards migrating to the public cloud to leverage their diverse and global network to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

‌

**Analysis** 

This issue was the result of a network failure affecting one of our POPs. These POPs possess two redundant transport circuits that are on diverse physical paths and are provided by two separate providers providing redundant connectivity. During this incident, the impacted POP experienced simultaneous failures of both of its redundant circuits due to separate service provider incidents. 

‌

Simultaneous failure of both transport circuits is a rare occurrence; in this case, the root cause was identified by the service providers as a “fiber cut“.  This dual failure isolated the impacted POP from the rest of the network. In response, we implemented a temporary backbone routing change to resolve the issue at that time, which temporarily diverted the impacted traffic to a sub-optimal path. Later the connectivity was restored to the original preferred path when one of the circuit recovered. After that, the second circuit also recovered, thereby restoring the redundant connectivity to the POP. 

‌

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* We have migrated 100% of our edge traffic to GCP. By doing this we have further reduced the dependence on on-premise POPs. 
* This now enables us to leverage Google’s global POP presence, further improving our global reach close to the customer location.

‌

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

From approximately 7:38 AM to 9:08AM US Pacific time, we had an issue impacting SSO logins and Box Notes. Our systems automatically detected and corrected the underlying issue. There is no current impact and no further updates will be provided here. If you are currently seeing any issues, please let us know at https://support.box.com.

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting the Box service. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

Between 3:58PM PDT and 5:42PM PDT on August 2, 2022, a small subset of our users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users of Box would have seen high latency or errors using the Box service. The issue occurred as a result of a result of a backend database receiving an increased volume of traffic that caused it to lag in responding to requests. We were able to resolve the issue by temporarily throttling the traffic. In addition, we changed a configuration value to more effectively utilize our caches and prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

‌

**Analysis** 

One of our internal database clusters experienced increased latency as a result of heavier-than-expected traffic from a subset of users. This may have resulted in latent or failed requests to Box for users who were assigned to this particular database cluster. In order to reduce load and improve latency on this cluster, our database engineers temporarily implemented a targeted throttler to reduce the volume of heavier traffic requests which restored overall service to nominal levels. In addition, our engineers identified and changed a configuration value that increased the effectiveness of our cache utilization when responding to this type of heavy traffic. By utilizing the cache more effectively, we are able to avoid sending such heavy traffic to the database, thus preventing similar issues from occurring in the future.

‌

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Change the cache configuration value to reduce load on the database when experiencing similar heavy traffic
* Implement more detailed monitoring in order to more quickly identify the source of heavy traffic to the database 

‌

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved. Box services have been restored to full functionality. Please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com/ if you continue to experience any issues.

incidents.name: [CRITICAL] Issue with Box Notes

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed an issue affecting JWT Logins, Uploads, Downloads, Box Notes and API requests. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain this issue and the steps we have taken to keep it from happening in the future.

Between 09:48 AM PDT and 10:15 AM PDT on July 8, 2022, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users experienced high latency and errors on JWT Login, Upload, Download, API and Box Notes features. The issue occurred because of an error in applying a configuration change to our traffic rate limiting infrastructure. We were able to quickly identify and resolve resolve the issue by rolling back the affecting change. Below is a summary of our analysis and corrective actions to prevent similar impact going forward. 

‌

**Analysis** 

The configuration change that caused the impact is related to our API infrastructure.  Part of the infrastructure is a component that controls the allowable request rate for various API endpoints based on a number of factors.  These factors are controlled by a configuration file.  Our engineering team was updating this configuration file to add a new rate limit entry when they applied an entry missing a required parameter.  As a result, the rate limiter system could not load its configuration, which caused the system to fail.

As a result of this incident we have identified a few key areas for improvement. First, we are improving our procedures regarding changes to the rate limiting system, adding more detail specifying required parameters and sample configurations for use in validating requests.  We have also conducted additional training with the team to reinforce the procedure. Additionally, we are investing in better automated validation of requests when they are submitted, ensuring they are well formed \(i.e., they contain all required parameters\).  This investment will reduce the likelihood of an incorrect configuration being applied to the system.  We believe the combination of automated configuration validation and improved documentation and training significantly improves our rate limiting system and mitigates similar future mistakes.

‌

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Improving our procedures regarding changes to the rate limiting system by adding more detail and sample configurations for use in validating requests.
* Conducting additional training to reinforce the procedure for making changes to the rate limiting system.
* Improving automated validation of requests to minimize the likelihood of incorrect configurations in the future.

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

From approximately 9:48 AM to 10:15 AM US Pacific time, we had an issue impacting Box Notes. Some users may have also experienced issues with logins, uploads, and downloads as well. Our systems automatically detected and corrected the underlying issue. There is no current impact and no further updates will be provided here. incidents.name: [CRITICAL] Issue with Box Services

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Box activity, including Box Metadata, file uploads and downloads, Box Notes, and the public API. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

On July 7th, 2022 between 6:02 PM PDT and 7:10 PM PDT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, users may have experienced higher than normal latency, timeouts and/or errors when trying to access Box via one of our applications or our public API. 

‌

**Analysis** 

This issue occurred due to instability in one of our HBase clusters. To improve the capacity of the Box Metadata service, our engineering teams deployed an expanded data storage cluster on the afternoon of July 7th. This cluster was tested prior to its deployment, and performed as expected in production immediately after deployment. Approximately 3 hours after the deployment of this cluster, a single server within the cluster exhibited dramatically increased latency caused by a defective memory module. This resulted in users experiencing degradation of uploads, downloads, Box Notes, and other related services. Our automated server failure detection methods did not detect this server as failed, and as a result, traffic continued to be directed to this server. Requests to this server developed a backlog, which affected latency of Box Metadata generally, which resulted in timeout errors and slow performance in other Box services. We were able to resolve the issue by diverting traffic to a healthy passive cluster. In addition, we are working on process and tooling improvements to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

‌

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* The defective server was removed from service and repairs effected.
* Revised datastore cluster deployment, onboarding and validation processes to prevent this issue from recurring in the future and to improve detection of problematic deployments.
* Improving resilience of Box services to high latencies when accessing datastores to minimize the impact of any similar issues in the future. 

‌

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

No additional impact has been observed during monitoring and all services are confirmed fully functional. We are considering the issue to be fully resolved. If you are encountering any issues, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Major] Issue with Uploads, Downloads, Logins, and Public API

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Logins, Public API, Uploads and Downloads. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 Between 3:50 pm PDT and 3:57 pm PDT on May 24th, 2022, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, users may have experienced slow login times as well as failures when attempting to upload and download files. 

**Analysis** 

The issue occurred as a result of a misconfiguration of a standard security scan that unexpectedly created performance issues. Specifically, the scanners were configured in a manner that caused an excessive number of authentication sessions on our network devices. This caused some network devices to run out of memory, which in turn resulted in slow login times as well as failures when attempting to upload and download files. The issue was resolved by stopping the scan. We have identified the root cause of the issue to be inefficient scan configurations. Moving forward, we are implementing more efficient scan configurations and improving our heath check alerting for all related vulnerability scans to prevent similar issues from occurring again in the future. 

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Implementing configuration changes to all related security scans
* Health check alerting for all related vulnerability scans

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

incidents.name: [Major] Issue with Uploads, Downloads, Logins, and Public API

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting uploads, downloads, logins, and public API. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

On May 17, 2022 between 11:05 AM PDT and 11:07 AM PDT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, uploads, downloads, logins, and public API experienced some failures or errors.

**Analysis**

The issue occurred when the leader node of an internal clustered system failed a soft restart. During a maintenance window, an internal infrastructure system that uses a leader-standby clustering model failed to elect a new leader. As a result, some users experienced issues with uploads, downloads, logins, and public API. Additionally, during the impacted timeframe, internal client services of the system did not rely on cached data as a fall-back, which exacerbated the issue. We were able to resolve this issue by issuing a hard restart of the affected node. We are continuing to investigate to determine the root cause of the issue and are developing additional corrective actions to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Performing a hard restart of the affected node to return it to a normal state.
* Identifying and addressing the underlying root cause of the cluster leader-election issue.
* Improving the clustering configuration to permit making a cluster passive before maintenance.
* Conducting further analysis to determine why internal services did not utilize cached internal data during the impacted timeframe.

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.

Sincerely,    
The Box Team

From approximately 11:07 AM to 11:14 AM US Pacific time, customers may have experienced issues with Box’s uploads, downloads, logins, and public API. Our systems automatically detected and corrected the underlying issue. If you are experiencing any issues with these services, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Minor] Issue with Public API

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting the User Events API. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

Between 10:00am PDT and 10:40am PDT on April 23, 2022, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, the User Events API may have experienced increased latency or failed to respond. 

**Analysis** 

The issue occurred as a result of an internal database cluster failure.  The Box User Events API retrieves information from a distributed database cluster that stores User Event data.  This distributed database cluster utilizes a common orchestration system to control various aspects of the service.  During the impacted timeframe, the orchestration system became degraded due to resource contention issues; as a result, the distributed database service was negatively impacted, and the User Events API experienced delays returning responses to user requests.  We were able to resolve the issue by migrating traffic to our standby database cluster.  Upon performing failover operations and restarting the impacted systems, we were able to successfully restore the service. In addition, we are reviewing the speed of our failover procedure and cause of the database cluster failure to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Deploying configuration changes to the coordination service to minimize the risk of recurrence of this issue. 

* Updating failover code and procedures to reduce overall failover time.

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

From approximately 10:00am - 10:40am PT on April 23rd, some users may have experienced issues with our Public API. Our teams have taken action to remediate this behavior and no additional impact has been observed. Please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com if you are currently seeing any issues.

incidents.name: [Outage] Box Sign page not loading.

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Box. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

On February 1st between 3:03 pm and 4:14 pm PT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, the Box Sign user interface may not have been accessible for some users and signed documents may have been processed with a delay. 

**Analysis** 

On February 1st networking and firewall changes were made in our ongoing effort to improve performance and stability. Due to this change our services were unable to reach out to an external service required for digitally signing documents. 

Our deployment/QA process did not test each individual external endpoint, and so this issue was not identified in the deployment/QA process. In addition, some alarms were misconfigured that would have reduced service degradation.  We were able to resolve the issue by whitelisting this external endpoint. 

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Improvements to our deployment/QA processes to test each individual endpoint for infrastructure changes. 

* Reconfiguration of alarms and improvements to observability with more granular alarms.

* Improvements to our replay process that can restart failed tasks to mitigate consequences should other issues resulting in failed task occur in the future.

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

incidents.name: [Minor] Issue With EMM Logins

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Mobile EMM Tier 1 logins. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between January 18, 2022, 2:00 PM PST and January 19, 2022, 1:42 AM PST, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, a subset of users utilizing Box for EMM may have encountered an error while attempting to log on. The issue occurred as a result of a configuration change that resulted in customers using EMM being unable to authenticate to Box. We were able to resolve the issue by reverting the change. 

**Analysis** 

The impacted back-end service accesses encrypted content from Box’s database by use of an encryption key. This key was previously supplied from our configuration system. Recently, Box migrated certain keys and other sensitive information to a different system. This migration resulted in a misconfiguration, which caused the service to be unable to properly read the key. As a result, a subset of customers may have experienced errors while attempting to log on.

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Improving Mobile EMM testing processes
* Enabling infrastructure to test EMM use cases in internal environments
* Improving alerting and monitoring capabilities of critical mobile services
* Making improvements to the back-end service to handle custom key-names and improve error messaging to help diagnose issues faster

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

From January 18th at 1:40pm to January 19th at 1:40am PT, some users utilizing Box for EMM may have encountered an error during the login attempt. Our team has taken actions to remediate this behavior and no additional impact has been observed. If you are still encountering any issues with Box for EMM, please contact us at https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: Degradation of Box Sign

incident_updates.body:
_Notice and disclaimer: Box is providing this preliminary information subject to further review and analysis. To the best of our knowledge, this is the current state and we will update as more information is confirmed._

‌

We recently addressed issues affecting Box Sign. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 Between January 12, 2022 at 9:50 PM PT until January 13, 2022 at 1:51 AM PT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, customers were not able to access Box Sign. The issue occurred due to a new firewall change, and we were able to resolve the issue by rolling back the new change. 

  
**Analysis** 

The problematic change had previously been pushed to our development environment without any issues. When pushing the change into our staging and production environments, there was a misconfiguration in the firewall change that blocked some traffic. The change was pushed to staging first, but a misconfiguration in our oncall alerts prevented the alert from properly reaching the oncalls. After 6 hours, this change was implemented in production with the same misconfiguration, which resulted in some service communications being blocked. A mix of the misconfiguration of oncall notification alerts and lack of proactive notifications of changes and change data caused diagnosis of this issue to take extra time.

  
**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Changing configurations to correct the oncall notification alert configuration.

* Changing practices to improve proactive notification of changes and change data. 

  
We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved. Box services have been restored to full functionality. Please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com/ if you continue to experience any issues.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
We have resolved the issue impacting Box Sign. We are continuing to monitor to ensure no further impact is observed

incidents.name: [Minor] Users in Asia-Pacific region may be unable to reach Box.

incident_updates.body:
UPDATED as of 2/4/2022 6:50 AM

We recently addressed issues affecting Box Web, Uploads/Downloads, Notes, and Mobile Applications. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 4:00 PM PST and 6:53 PM PST on January 12, 2022, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, Box users in the APAC region may have experienced poor performance and increased latency while using Box. The issue occurred as a result of a misconfiguration that impacted the addition of a new Internet transit provider in the APAC region. We were able to resolve the issue by disabling BGP traffic to the new provider. In addition, we have modified our BGP policy and are working with our vendor to address a misconfiguration on their side to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

**Analysis** 

As part of our ongoing effort to improve the customer experience for users in the APAC region, Box added a new Internet transit provider. However, as a result of a misconfiguration, this new provider began taking traffic from some customer networks that should not have been routed over the circuit. As a result of this unexpected traffic, the new circuit became oversaturated, resulting in the performance issues and increased latency. We were able to resolve the issue by disabling BGP traffic to the new provider and are gradually increasing traffic in a slow, controlled manner to prevent performance issues from reoccurring.

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* We have worked with the vendor to identify the underlying issue and conduct a formal post-mortem on the vendor's side.

* We are gradually increasing traffic in a slow, controlled manner to this new provider. 

* We are addressing a monitoring gap that prevented us from detecting the issue earlier.

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

incidents.name: [Minor] Delayed information in User Details Report

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting admin reports. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.  

Between December 16, 2021 at 9:00 am PT and January 5, 2022 at 8:08 am PT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some admin reports reflecting data about the current state of a Box deployment may have been out of date. Reports on actions taken, such as the User Activity Report, were not affected. The issue occurred due to a faulty maintenance operation that temporarily prevented us from updating the data used to generate the affected reports. We were able to resolve the issue by adjusting the system to be more reliable and handle extra data. In addition, we have revised our maintenance procedures to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

**Analysis** 

This issue was triggered by a routine maintenance operation that was incorrectly executed. This left the process that provides updated data from our database to the admin reporting feature in an unusual state that our monitoring failed to identify as problematic. Though the available data became increasingly recent as the issue was remediated, it took time to fully recover given the backlog of updates that this issue created.  
**Corrective Actions**  
The following corrective actions have been completed:

* Hardened monitoring to handle edge cases that can arise during known maintenance procedures and immediately alert if deviations are detected

* Tuned the affected process to be resilient in the face large backlogs

* Increased capacity to process data well in excess of normal operations  

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.   

Sincerely,  

The Box Team

We’ve addressed the underlying delay that led to the User Details Report not being up to date. While the issue has been remediated, there is still a backlog to be processed.
As a workaround, Admins can run a User Activity Report and filter for the information that’s available in the User Details Report. The information from the User Activity Report is not affected, as the delay is only limited to the User Details Report.
We're considering this issue resolved. Please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com if you are currently seeing any issues.

incidents.name: [Minor] Searching in "Users & Groups" within Admin Console will not generate results

incident_updates.body:
_Notice and disclaimer: Box is providing this preliminary information subject to further review and analysis. To the best of our knowledge, this is the current state and we will update as more information is confirmed._

We recently addressed issues that resulted in the search feature not working as expected in Users and Groups in the Admin Console. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

From December 8, 2021 at 3:36 PM PT until December 9, 2021 at 12:25 PM PT, some users may have experienced difficulties while attempting to use the search feature in the Users and Groups pages in the Admin Console. This issue was caused by an update not working as anticipated. We were able to resolve the issue by reverting to the previous release until we were able to identify and remedy the issue in the update.

**Analysis**     
The issue occurred as a result of certain updates that did not work as expected. As part of these updates, some keywords were included in the code that were not compatible with some of the newer dependencies installed. We were able to resolve the issue by reverting to the previous release. In addition, we updated the code at issue to use more modern keywords to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

**Corrective Actions**  
The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* We reverted to the previous working release of the Admin Console.
* We identified the dependency issues and replaced incompatible keywords with more modern keywords.
* We validated that the solution resolved the issue through manual and automated testing.
* We plan to improve our testing to more effectively prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.

Sincerely,    
The Box Team
The issue impacting the ability to search within Users and Groups in the Admin Console is now resolved. If you are still encountering any issues please reach out to us at https://support.box.com.

We have received reports that the search function within the Users & Groups tab of the Admin Console is not providing results.

incidents.name: [Critical] FTP Unavailable

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting the Box FTP service. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 4:00 PM and 7:29 PM PST on Nov 17, 2021, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, clients validating the SSL chain of trust were unable to connect to our FTP servers. The issue occurred as a result of FTP certs expiration. During this time, use of other Box applications, including the Box web application, Box desktop applications, or Box APIs was not affected. We were able to resolve the issue by generating and deploying a new Java Keystore. In addition, we will define a process to monitor and update FTP certs to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

**Analysis**     
FTP service is an application layer built on top of upload and download API. It allows users to upload and download files using FTP protocol. Box supports both encrypted FTP and unencrypted FTP protocol.

In this incident, the FTP SSL certificate expired at 4:00 PM PST on Nov 17, 2021. As a result, users trying to establish new SSL connections to FTP hosts were unable to connect. We were able to resolve the issue by generating and deploying a new Java Keystore.

**Corrective Actions**  
The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Set up a process to better monitor upcoming FTP cert expiration;
* Define and document the process to manage and renew FTP certs;
* Review FTP Runbook and update the process to manage FTP certs;
* Include FTP Catchpoint test results in FTP dashboard.

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.

Sincerely,    
The Box Team

From approximately 4:00pm - 9:30pm PT, some customers experienced failures with FTP uploads and downloads due to an expired SSL certificate. The certificate has been updated which resolved this issue. If you are still experiencing issues with FTP, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Critical] Issue with Box Embed Uploads

incident_updates.body:
\*\*\*UPDATED: Oct 18, 2021 @ 12:41 PM PT

We recently addressed issues affecting uploads via Box Embed Widget and a subset of accelerated uploads. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 1:00PM PDT on September 23, 2021 and 10:23PM PDT on September 27, 2021, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, customers uploading via Box Embed Widget would see an error notification and multiple uploads of the same file. For customers uploading via accelerated nodes with the IP Allowlist feature enabled, users experienced errors in the upload. The issue occurred as a result of a recent code change in our upload service intended to clean up some deprecated pathways. We were able to resolve the issue by reverting the change and restoring to a previous known version. In addition, we are adding several new tests and alerts as part of the deployment process to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

**Analysis** 

As part of regular updates, an upload service deployment was done in production. This change incorrectly overwrote a header that is used by downstream services to determine the original context of the upload. As such, in the Embed Widget case, the downstream service failed to recognize that CORS headers need to be set in the response. This caused errors only on the client side, which were not visible to the service. Corrective actions are being taken to ensure both the client and server side is aware of this change going forward in a timely manner.

In the IP Allowlisting and accelerated nodes case, the upload was not recognized to be from the original source through accelerated node and thus failed authorization check.

We were able to resolve the issue by reverting the change and restoring to a previous known version. After the revert of the deployment, the issue was mitigated.

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Adding additional testing and alerting during the development for html5 uploads

* Adding additional testing and alerting during the development for IP Allowlist and accelerator combination

* Adding a sanity environment before full deployment of upload-proxy service

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 Sincerely,

The Box Team

‌

incidents.name: [Major] Issue delayed information in Admin Reports

incident_updates.body:
\*\*\*\*\*Updated Oct 18, 2021 @ 12:44 PM PT\*\*\*\*\*

We recently addressed issues affecting user reports. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 From August 31, 2021 at 5:30 am PDT to September 11, 2021 at 12:47 PDT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, customers experienced stale data in certain Batch Admin Reports. The issue occurred as a result of latent scale issues. We were able to resolve the issue by tuning configurations in our ingestion pipeline. In addition, we are working on a more scalable ingestion pipeline to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

**Analysis** 

The pipeline that ingests data to be used for reports relies on temporary buffer tables before compacting the data into final tables. The buffer tables have an index to keep track of all of its files. These indexes require maintenance to avoid placing an undue strain on the system. In this case, the size of the indexes and resulting strain created a backlog that impacted data freshness of Batch Admin Reports.

We are currently working on an overhaul of how we ingest and maintain the data for reports. In this system, the index will constantly be maintained and not put pressure on the system.

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Truncate the buffer tables indexes

* Add additional metrics to root cause the issue faster

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 Sincerely,

The Box Team

incidents.name: Critical: Issue with Admin Events API

incident_updates.body:
_Updated Nov 11, 2021_

We recently addressed issues affecting the Box Web Application. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 Between 6:30 p.m. PDT on August 29, 2021 and 12:30 p.m. PDT on August 30, 2021**,** some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some request may have taken longer than usual to complete and some uploads may have failed. The issue occurred due to a misconfiguration of a third-party library used to increase performance. We were able to resolve the issue by optimizing the library for use within the Web Application. In addition, we have set up active monitoring of this library to quickly diagnose similar issues going forward.

**Analysis** 

The Box Web Application has a caching layer built in to store frequently used values in order to improve response time to requests. A change in usage caused the internal cache memory to become fragmented, resulting in some servers taking longer to serve requests, and adding load to downstream systems serving cached values. This extra load caused cascading failures and resulted in some uploads failing.

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* We will now be immediately alerted when servers are unable to cache values due to fragmentation

* Cache tuning was improved to make fragmentation extremely unlikely

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 Sincerely,

The Box Team

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

We recently addressed issues affecting timeliness of the Events API. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 8:43 am PDT and 3:25 pm PDT on August 30th, 2021, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, the real-time Events API sporadically experienced unusual latency. The issue occurred as a result of performance issues in the backing store that powers our Events API. We were able to resolve the issue by migrating traffic to our secondary cluster. In addition, we have increased capacity and conducted additional performance tuning on the cluster to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

**Analysis**

On the morning of August 30th, 2021, the backing store that powers the Events API experienced performance degradation under the load of read traffic that was querying it.  This caused requests to intermittently fail until we migrated traffic to our secondary cluster.

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Apply additional performance tuning changes to our database cluster to increase performance.
* Increase capacity for both of the database clusters to better service the higher read traffic volume.

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.

Sincerely,

The Box Team

incidents.name: [Critical] Issue with Box User Events API

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting the internal Monolith service. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 9:22am PDT and 9:50am PDT on August 20th 2021, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, the Box User Events API endpoint may have been delayed. The issue occurred due to internal coordination and configuration system being in a degraded state.  We were able to resolve the issue by restarting the leader of the coordination system manually. To further prevent similar issues from occurring in the future we are implementing an automatic restart mechanism for this condition.

**Analysis** 

Our internal messaging system at Box utilizes a common orchestration system to control various aspects of the service.  This orchestration system became degraded due to resource contention issues, which caused other systems to be negatively impacted.  As a result, our database cluster that powers the User Events API was delayed in returning responses to user requests.  Upon restarting the impacted systems we were able to successfully restore service.

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Automatic detection and remediation of the impacted coordination service.

* Reduction of extraneous logging to reduce resource contention.

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

 Sincerely,

The Box Team

incidents.name: [Critical] Issue with generating Reports

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Enterprise Reports. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 1:25am and 10:51am on July 13, 2021, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, Enterprise Reports could not be generated. The issue occurred as a result of an image dependency that was reverted within one of our cloud vendors' environments. As a result, the service was temporarily unable to provision computational resources to execute the report jobs. We were able to resolve the issue by rebuilding the images. In addition, we are working to increase our monitoring sensitivity to such failures and reviewing our image lifecycles to prevent similar vendor issues from impacting customers in the future. 

**Analysis** 

One of Box's cloud vendors made a change to cloud compute dependencies that our Enterprise Reports image pipeline leverages as part of creating computational resources for job execution.  After the next run of our image pipeline, the Enterprise Report job image included a failing dependency from our cloud vendor.  After  our cloud vendor reverted the problematic change and Box generated a new image, Box's Enterprise Reports were able to resume successfully.

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Increase monitoring sensitivity to report-generation failures

* Review image lifecycles to limit the potential impact of dependency changes

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter. 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved. Box services have been restored to full functionality. Please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com/ if you continue to experience any issues.

incidents.name: Issue with Admin Events API

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting timeliness of the Events API. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

On Thursday, July 8, 2021 between 1:15PM PT and 4:05PM PT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, notifications may have slowed down for some users, and some Drive users may have experienced delays. This issue occurred as a result of an unexpected surge in traffic because of an internal migration. We were able to resolve the issue by adding more capacity to the affected service. In addition, we have added alerts to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

  

**Analysis** 

A migration involving one of Box's backend services caused a sudden uptick in the incoming traffic to our messaging pipeline. Due to a preset protective limit, some of that incoming traffic was restricted, causing certain events to slow down.  The engineers investigating the issue were able to add additional capacity to the messaging service, and the issue resolved soon thereafter. 

  

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Adding additional capacity to the messaging pipeline

* Adding new alerts to page the on-call engineers when traffic to the messaging pipeline is close to hitting the preset limit

  

  

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.  

Sincerely,

The Box Team
